transcript:
He took the glove in silence from the aide-de-camp, and sat down in the lady's chair, placing his huge hands symmetrically on his knees in the nai've attitude of an Egyptian statue, and de- cided in his own mind that all was as it should be, and that in order not to lose his head and do foolish things he must not act on his own ideas tonight, but must yield himself up entire- ly to the will of those who were guiding him. 
Not two minutes had passed before Prince Vasili with head erect majest
